p: Shaded plants had significantly lower average total biomass (-77.8%) and storage root biomass (-93.2%) ( Table 2, Fig 2), also differed substantially from control plants in biomass allocations and functional traits, with a strong induction of the shading-avoidance response ( Table 2, Figs 3 and 4). Shaded plants had lower root/shoot ratio (-65.4%) and branch intensity (-56.8%) ( Table 2, Fig 3), but had increased specific stem length (SSL, +235.7%) and specific leaf area (+ 56.3%) ( Table 2, Fig 4).
